sn9.4:4.1: At one time several mendicants were staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.4:4.2: Then when the three months of the rains residence had passed those mendicants set out wandering.
sn9.4:4.3: Not seeing those mendicants, the deity haunting that forest cried. And on that occasion they recited this verse:
sn9.4:5.2: it seems to me that they must have become dissatisfied.
sn9.4:5.3: They were so learned, such brilliant speakers!
sn9.4:5.4: Where have these disciples of Gotama gone?”
sn9.4:6.1: When they had spoken, another deity replied with this verse:
sn9.4:7.1: “They’ve gone to Magadha, they’ve gone to Kosala,
sn9.4:7.2: and some are in the Vajjian lands.
sn9.4:7.3: Like deer that wander free of ties,
sn9.4:7.4: the mendicants live with no abode.”
